alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 12:29PM CDT until July 08 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN JOHNSON COUNTY... At 1229 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Iowa City, West Branch, Coralville, Newport, Morse, West Overlook, Elmira, Coralville Lake Dam Complex, Oasis and Sugar Bottom Camp Ground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 243 and 253. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Nicholson Creek, Gower Creek, Clear Creek, Rapid Creek, Ralston Creek, Sanders Creek, Jordan Creek, Iowa River, Turkey Creek, Snyder Creek, Middle Branch Wapsinonoc Creek and Wapsinonoc Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
